schema.name: Adlai Carrot Fried Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse the Adlai Rice under cold water until the water runs clear.
Cook the Adlai Rice according to package instructions until tender, about 20 minutes, then set aside.
Peel and dice the carrots into small pieces.
Crack the egg into a bowl, beating it lightly with a fork.
Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add the coconut. Wait until it is hot, then add the diced carrots. Cook for about 5 minutes until they start to soften.
Push the carrots to one side of the pan, and pour in the beaten egg on the other side. Let it set for a minute before scrambling it and mixing with the carrots.
Add the cooked Adlai Rice to the pan. Season with salt. Stir everything together and cook for an additional 5 minutes, making sure the rice is heated through.

schema.description: This Adlai Carrot Fried Rice is a perfect harmony of health and taste, ideal for those following a low-carb and low-sugar diet. Infused with wholesome ingredients like Adlai Rice, fresh carrots, and coconut, it's a healthy twist to your traditional fried rice that does not compromise on flavor. A great addition to your healthy recipes collection, this dish is packed with nutrients and easily fits into your health-conscious lifestyle.
